Taxon name.Name: Collariella virescens
Taxon name.Synonymy:
Current name: Achaetomiella virescens Arx 1970 MB#308086 
Taxonomic synonyms: 
   - Chaetomium virescens (Arx) Udagawa 1980 MB#121660 
   - Collariella virescens (Arx) X. Wei Wang & Samson 2016 MB#819488

Substrate of isolation: wheat straw compost prepared for mushroom growing
Restrictions on use: for commercial development a special agreement is requested
Nagoya protocol restrictions and complia: no known restrictions under the Nagoya protocol
History: IHEM, 1991 < ATCC < D. Hawksworth < D. Singh Chahal
Applications: solid state fermentation for single-cell protein production (Dev. Ind. Microbiol. 21: 425-434, 1980; Eur. J. Appl. Microbiol. Biotechnol. 16: 219-222, 1982); SCP from sag canning industry waste (Indian J. Exp. Biol. 17: 789-791, 1979), by degradation of lignocellulosics (Dev. Ind. Microbiol. 22: 143-159, 1981), from unwashed alkali-pretreated corn stover (Adv. Biotechnol. 2: 327-332, 1982), by degradation of corn stover (Mycologia 75: 597-603, 1983); produces: cellobiose dehydrogenase (Biotechnol. Lett. 4: 775-780, 1982), endo-ß-glucanase (ibid., 6: 251-256, 1984), xylanase (ibid., 9: 275-280, 1987) and dextranase (J. Appl. Bacteriol. 79: 203-212, 1995); pilot plant production of single-cell protein from pulp mill wastes (Dev. Ind. Microbiol. 25: 621-631, 1984); conversion of agricultural wastes into animal feed (U.S. Pat. 4,526,791)
